property.name: text
property.value:
This is a model of a point source transmitting data over different channel characteristics. The Receiver actor has five identical instances, each receiving the same data sequence over different channels with fault characteristics.
Two types of faults have been defined: Stuck-At Fault: The channel gets stuck at a certain value with some probability during each token transfer and if it gets stuck, it repeats the last healthy value from then on.
Packet Drop: For each packet that is transmitted, the packet gets dropped with some probability.

property.name: text
property.value: Note that the order in which fault "aspects" are associated to an input port changes the behavior of the connection.

entity.name: Ramp
entity.doc: Create a sequence of tokens with increasing value

property.name: legend
property.value: packet drop, stuck-at, stuck-at+packet drop, no faults

svg.text: A packet-drop state machine that independently drops a each with 20% chance.
